reasoning: Esophageal and gastric varices are complications of portal hypertension, primarily from liver cirrhosis. Reported as prevalence rather than incidence. Estimated ~7,000 per 100k based on global cirrhosis prevalence (4-5%) and proportion developing esophageal varices (30-40%) or gastric varices (5-15%). Geographic variation significant: Southeast Asia/East Asia >15% prevalence due to higher HBV/HCV rates; developed countries 5-8% due to alcohol-related cirrhosis patterns.
